translated: Thus, he thinks, ‚ÄúEven the state of enlightenment, the unsurpassed method for liberating all beings, cannot be attained without completing the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

analyzed: tshogs gnyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The two accumulations are included in the six perfections.

translated: Therefore, I will always complete all of them, beginning with the perfection of generosity.‚Äù

original: smon par byed do //
analyzed: smon par byed do //
translated: He aspires to each of the six perfections.

original: gzhan yang de 'di ltar sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'di ltar sems skyed par byed de /
translated: Moreover, he generates the following thought:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe perfection of generosity is threefold:

original: zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pas dbye bas so //
analyzed: zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pas dbye bas so //
translated: It is divided into the generosity of material things, the generosity of fearlessness, and the generosity of the Dharma.

original: de la chos kyi sbyin pa yang sems can ma bsdus pa rnams la sbyin par mi nus kyis /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sbyin pa yang sems can ma bsdus pa rnams la sbyin par mi nus kyis /
translated: Among them, the generosity of the Dharma cannot be given to beings who are not gathered.

original: de ni bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi po dag gis sgrub par nus so //
analyzed: de ni bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi po dag gis sgrub par nus so //
translated: It can be accomplished by the four persuasions.

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sems can bsdu bar bya'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sems can bsdu bar bya'o /
translated: Therefore, one should gather beings with giving, pleasant speech, beneficence, and sameness of purpose.

original: zhes sems can bsdu ba'i don du smon lam bzhi po gzhan bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes sems can bsdu ba'i don du smon lam bzhi po gzhan bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should generate the four aspirations for gathering beings.

original: zhes sems skyed par byed de /
analyzed: zhes sems skyed par byed de /
translated: Thus, one generates the thought.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyi nang nas zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa gnyis ni bsdu ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyi nang nas zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa gnyis ni bsdu ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin la /
translated: Among the three types of giving, the two of giving material things and giving fearlessness are the means of gathering.

analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni thabs des bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The giving of Dharma is accomplished by that means.

original: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa la smon pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa la smon pa drug dang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, there are six aspirations for the perfections and four for the means of gathering.

original: langs pa'i tshul ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: langs pa'i tshul ni 'di yin te /

original: mig gnyis phye nas sngar rtog pa'i gnas skabs bor te /
analyzed: mig gnyis phye nas sngar rtog pa'i gnas skabs bor te /
translated: Having opened both eyes, one should cast off the previous state of imagination.

original: mdun du lta ba'i mtshan ma byas pa'i gnas rnams la lta bar bya zhing /

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de rnams kyi ming nas bzung zhing phyogs kyi mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
translated: As before, one should recite their names and grasp the signs of the directions.

original: lce rkan nas phab ste kha la byugs nas de'i 'og tu sngon bzhin du dbugs brngubs pa dang dbugs dbyung ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: lce rkan nas phab ste kha la byugs nas de'i 'og tu sngon bzhin du dbugs brngubs pa dang dbugs dbyung ba dag bya'o //
translated: Having lowered the tongue from the palate and wiped the mouth, one should then, as before, inhale and exhale.

analyzed: de nas dal bus lus bskyod de skyil mo krung bshig nas ngal bso ste lus dang sems las su rung bar byas la /
translated: Then, slowly moving the body, one should break the cross-legged position and rest, making the body and mind serviceable.

original: ci nas 'khrul pa med par ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas 'khrul pa med par ldang bar bya'o //
translated: I will arise without any error.

original: langs nas sems legs par mnyam par gzhag pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa spyad cing /
analyzed: langs nas sems legs par mnyam par gzhag pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa spyad cing /
translated: Having arisen, I will practice the conduct of generosity and so forth by means of the mind well-equipoised, by means of the method of non-observation.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po skyil mo krung bcas te bzhugs ba bsam gtan gyi snyoms par zhugs shing 'gro ba la gzigs pa mdun du bsam par bya'o //

translated: In this way, I will visualize the Bhagavat Buddha, the Great Lord of Yogins, seated in the cross-legged posture, absorbed in the meditative equipoise, and looking at the world.

original: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i lam /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i lam /
translated: The Path of Meditation of the Yogin

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi zhabs kyi padma'i ze'u 'bru spyi bos len pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi zhabs kyi padma'i ze'u 'bru spyi bos len pa /
translated: The one who receives on his crown the pollen of the lotus feet of the Noble Manjushri,

original: sde snod gsum la mkhas pa slob dpon ye shes snying pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
